data.title: Cohorts
content: A "cohort" is a group of participants that a group of researchers are interested in. The cohort builder allows you to create and review cohorts and annotate participants in a researcher’s study group.

data.title: Concept Sets
content: Concepts describe information in a patient’s medical record, such as a condition they have, a prescription they are taking or their physical measurements.
Subject areas such as conditions, drugs, measurements, etc. are called "domains."
Concept sets are collections of concepts from a particular domain, that users can save and use to create a dataset for analysis.

data.title: Datasets
content: Datasets are analysis-ready tables that can be exported to analysis tools such as Notebooks.
Users can build and preview a dataset for one or more cohorts by selecting the desired concept sets and values for the cohorts.

data.title: Recent Data
content: This area displays recently opened data types like cohorts, concept sets, or datasets.

data.title: Data Type
content: This table displays details about cohorts, concept sets, and data sets within the workspace, including the name, owner and last changed date.

conceptSets.title: Concept Sets
content: Concepts describe information in a patient’s medical record, such as a condition they have, a prescription they are taking or their physical measurements.
Subject areas such as conditions, drugs, measurements, etc. are called "domains."
Concept sets are collections of concepts from a particular domain, that users can save.

content.title: Conditions
content: Conditions are listed by ICD9 or ICD10 or SNOMED standard codes.

content.title: Procedures
content: Procedures are listed by ICD9, ICD10, or CPT or SNOMED standard codes.

content.title: Drugs
content: Drugs or medications are listed by ingredient and organized by therapeutic uses.

content.title: Measurements
content: Measurements refer to laboratory tests and vital signs and are organized in the LOINC (Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes) code hierarchy. Also included in this section are Program Physical Measurements recorded when a participant enrolls in the program.

content.title: Visits
content: Visits refer to the type of facility at which the participant received medical care (e.g. emergency room, outpatient, inpatient).

content.title: Surveys
content: Questions and associated response options for participant completed surveys.

content.title: Physical Measurements
content: Measurements taken at the time of participant enrollment, including blood pressure, heart rate, height, weight, body mass index (BMI), waist and hip circumference, pregnancy status and wheelchair use.

content.title: Demographics
content: Age, gender, race, ethnicity and deceased status.

cohortBuilder.title: Cohort Overview
content: A "Cohort" is a group of participants you are interested in researching. The cohort builder allows you to create and review cohorts and annotate participants in your study group. As you add inclusion and exclusion criteria from various domains, the cohort will include or exclude participants from the full All of Us cohort to only the participants that meet your selected criteria.

content.title: Include Participants Where
content: The INCLUDE Participants WHERE clause is used to extract only those participant records that fulfill a specified condition/procedure/demographic/drug/etc.

content.title: Exclude Participants Where
content: The EXCLUDE Participants WHERE clause is used to remove those participant records that fulfill a specified condition/procedure/demographic/drug/etc.

content.title: Surveys
content: Questions and associated response options for participant completed surveys.

content.title: Physical Measurements
content: Measurements taken at the time of participant enrollment, including blood pressure, heart rate, height, weight, body mass index (BMI), waist and hip circumference, pregnancy status and wheelchair use.

content.title: Demographics
content: Age, gender, race, ethnicity and deceased status.

content.title: Conditions
content: Conditions listed by ICD9 or ICD10 or SNOMED standard codes.

content.title: Procedures
content: Procedures listed by ICD9, ICD10 or CPT or SNOMED standard codes.

content.title: Drugs
content: Drugs or medications are listed by ingredient and organized by therapeutic uses.

content.title: Measurements
content: Measurements refer to laboratory tests and vital signs and are organized in the LOINC (Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes) code hierarchy.

content.title: Visits
content: Visits refer to the type of facility at which the participant received medical care (e.g. emergency room, outpatient, inpatient).

content.title: Source and Standard Search
content: The All of Us Research Program employs Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model Version 5 infrastructure to ensure feasibility and standardization across all program data types (physical measurements, electronic health records and PPI). Medical concepts are recorded in the EHR as standard codes (e.g. ICD9, ICD10, CPT, etc.). These codes are then mapped to standard vocabularies such as LOINC, ICD9, or SNOMED and the associated "standard" concept_id. Sometimes the source vocabulary is the same as the standard vocabulary. All medical concepts can be searched via either the standard or source vocabulary concept_id.
Upon entering a standard code in the search bar, a list of all matching standard codes will be generated. To see the standard vocabulary equivalent, select "STANDARD VOCABULARY."

content.title: Modifiers
content: Modifiers allow you to specify the age at event, date of event and/or number of occurrences for a selected criteria. Privacy preserving methods in our curated data set require that all dates are consistently shifted within a particular participants record.

content.title: Temporal
content: Temporal relationships allow you to search for participants using criteria domains as a group and relating them with time.

cohortBuilder.title: Group Count
content: The group count displays the number of participant records if any of the criteria joined by the OR operator are true.

cohortBuilder.title: Total Count
content: The total count displays the number of participant records if all of the criteria joined by the AND operator are true.

cohortBuilder.title: Generate Review Set
content: In order to validate the criteria you used to create your cohort, you can create a subset of participant records you wish to review in detail

datasetBuilder.title: Dataset Builder
datasetBuilder.content: Datasets are analysis-ready tables containing data about a Cohort can be exported to analysis tools such as Notebooks. Users can build and preview a dataset for one or more cohorts by selecting the desired concepts sets and values for the cohorts.

reviewParticipants.title: Participant Status
reviewParticipants.content: Within the Review Set, you can review individual participant records and choose to include, exclude, or mark them for further review.

reviewParticipants.title: Annotations
reviewParticipants.content: Within the Review Set, you have the option of creating a review-set-wide annotation or set of annotations. Annotations allow you to add an explanation (free text), date, number (numeric field), selection from a specified list (dropdown list) or checkbox to each participant record.

reviewParticipantDetail.title: Participant Status
reviewParticipantDetail.content: Within the Review Set, you can review individual participant records and choose to include, exclude, or mark them for further review.

reviewParticipantDetail.title: Annotations
reviewParticipantDetail.content: Within the Review Set, you have the option of creating a review-set-wide annotation or set of annotations. Annotations allow you to add an explanation (free text), date, number (numeric field), selection from a specified list (dropdown list) or checkbox to each participant record.

reviewParticipantDetail.title: Create a Review Set-Wide Annotation Field
reviewParticipantDetail.content: Annotation field will appear across all Participants in this Review Set. Input in the field will be on a participant by participant basis.

reviewParticipantDetail.title: Edit or Delete a Review Set-Wide Annotation Field
reviewParticipantDetail.content: Edit or Delete an Annotation Field across all Review Sets created in this set.
